meanings.definition: The part of a golf club that strikes the ball.
meanings.sent1: The golfer carefully aimed the clubhead at the golf ball.
meanings.sent2: The clubhead of the golf club is usually made of metal.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel mistook the shiny clubhead for a nut and tried to bury it.
meanings.sent4: Her words hit him like a clubhead, leaving a lasting impact.
meanings.sent5: The clubhead gleamed in the sunlight, ready to make contact with the ball.

meanings.definition: A heavy object used as a weapon.
meanings.sent1: The knight wielded the clubhead in battle against the enemy.
meanings.sent2: The criminal used a metal clubhead to break into the safe.
meanings.sent3: The chef jokingly referred to the meat tenderizer as a clubhead for stubborn steaks.
meanings.sent4: His words were like a clubhead, striking her heart with force.
meanings.sent5: The clubhead of the hammer pounded the nail into the wood effortlessly.

meanings.definition: A group or organization of people with a common interest or purpose.
meanings.sent1: The book clubhead met every Thursday to discuss the latest novel.
meanings.sent2: She was a proud member of the environmental clubhead at school.
meanings.sent3: The knitting clubhead decided to yarn-bomb the town square for a fun surprise.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was a strong clubhead, holding them together through thick and thin.
meanings.sent5: The clubhead of volunteers worked tirelessly to clean up the park for the community.
